answers.answer: Dehydration can be common in pregnancy. That's the first thing. Now, that being said, I would mention it to the dr. It can be a sign of diabetes and low amniotic fluid among other things. (All of which are not super likely). Also the fear of the baby not getting nutrition. Baby is going to take what they need. If they have to steal it from your body they will. So the bigger fear is your nutrition. Good luck hon

question: Hello ladies.  Ever since I hv entered 3 trimester I feel thirsty all d tym. I drink a lot of water coz of which I dont eat as much as I shud. Feels guilty as my baby might not b getting enough nutrition.  Anyone else with same issue?? M 33+4 today
title: super thirrsty
